name: Drivinity
description:
We are a student team from the Breda University, NHTV, The Netherlands.

Our game started with the programmers developing a multi-platform (PlayStation 4 and Windows) custom Engine, called Lux Engine, tailored for anti-gravity racing games in the third Block of 2018 (8 weeks).

In combination with the Lux Engine, we make use of Unity as scene editor, and a custom tool  to create procedural tracks. This tool was made in Houdini by our technical artist.

We started developing Drivinity in the last block (8 weeks) of our second year with a team of designers, artists & programmers (21 members in total). 

We are proud to announce we are ready to release our game Drivinity!

Awards
  • Winner of the 2018 IGAD Award for best programming year 2.
  • Runner Up of the 2018 IGAD Audience Award for year 2.
Reviews and Quotes
  • "Probably the first student racing game where I was not cursing the vehicle the whole time." Bojan Endrovski, IGAD Lecturer.
